text: The Wilson's bird-of-paradise is a small bird of the Paradisaeidae family. == Description == The male is a red and black bird-of-paradise with a yellow mantle on its neck, a light-green mouth, blue feet and two curved violet tail feathers. The head is naked blue with a black double cross pattern on it. As so often with birds in general, and paradise birds in particular, the female is not showy. It is a brownish bird, though it does have a bare blue crown. == Diet == Wilson's bird-of-paradise eat usually fruit or small insects. == References == Category:Paradisaeidae Category:Birds of Oceania
title: Wilson's bird-of-paradise
